title: Java Method Overloading
subject: Java
learning_objectives: Why return type change isn't overloading
theory:
Method Overloading allows a class to have more than one method having the same name, if their argument lists are different.
This increases the readability of the program.

examples.code:
System.out.println(10); // calls println(int)
System.out.println("Hi"); // calls println(String)
examples.explanation: Standard println is a perfect example of overloading.

common_mistakes.correction: int foo() and void foo() is Duplicate Method Error. Compiler must distinguish calls by parameters.

interview_questions.question: Can we overload main() method?
interview_questions.answer: Yes! But JVM only calls `main(String[] args)`.

practice_problems.problem: Create `area` method for Circle (radius) and Rectangle (l, b).
practice_problems.hint: area(double r), area(double l, double b)

real_world_use_cases.description: Providing flexible ways to call a library function (e.g. `log(msg)` vs `log(msg, error)`).

exam_notes: Type Promotion (int passed to double param) applies to overloading finding.
summary: Overloading allows cleaner APIs using the same name for similar actions.
